item.title: 可能改变世界的新型磁铁
item.description:
在彭博社原创系列Primer的首播节目中，您将发现一种新型磁铁可能会如何结束对充满危机的供应链的依赖。【原文：

On the premiere episode of the Bloomberg Originals series Primer, discover how a new kind of magnet might end reliance on fraught supply chains.

】

item.title: 石油指标显示西方主要原油市场疲软
item.description: 布伦特原油期货交易价格罕见地贴水于中东石油，欧洲和地中海地区不断增长的产量给支撑全球基准的高品质石油市场带来了压力。【原文：Brent crude futures are trading at a rare discount to Middle Eastern oil, with growing production in Europe and the Mediterranean heaping pressure onto markets for the high-quality oil that underpins the global benchmark.】

item.title: 南非在美国关税不确定性下暂停宽松周期
item.description: 南非央行暂停宽松周期，同时评估美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策可能对通胀产生的影响。【原文：South Africa’s central bank paused its easing cycle while it assesses the impact US President Donald Trump’s trade policies may have on inflation.】

item.title: 欧洲央行莱恩支持数字欧元以避免稳定币风险上升
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）表示，欧洲需要一种数字货币来抵御稳定币等新货币形式的威胁，并在政治紧张局势加剧的情况下减少对美国支付公司的依赖。【原文：Europe needs a digital currency to safeguard against threats from new forms of money like stablecoins, and reduce reliance on US payments firms amid heightened political tensions, European Central Bank Chief Economist Philip Lane said.】

item.title: 人工智能云计算公司 CoreWeave 寻求撤回 IPO，筹资 27 亿美元
item.description: 作为人工智能领域最热门的初创企业之一，云计算供应商 CoreWeave Inc.【原文：CoreWeave Inc., a cloud-computing provider that’s one of the hottest startups in artificial intelligence, and some of its investors are seeking to raise about $2.7 billion in an initial public offering.】

item.title: 就业市场稳健，美国申请失业救济人数保持低位
item.description: 上周美国失业救济金申请人数变化不大，处于相对较低的水平，凸显了劳动力市场的韧性。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits were little changed last week at a relatively low level that underscores a resilient labor market.】

item.title: 比尔-奇肖恩集团成为收购波士顿凯尔特人队的领跑者
item.description: 据知情人士透露，包括 STG Partners 联合创始人比尔-奇肖姆（Bill Chisholm）在内的一个财团已成为收购美国篮球协会波士顿凯尔特人队的领跑者。【原文：A consortium that includes STG Partners co-founder Bill Chisholm has emerged as the front-runner to acquire the National Basketball Association’s Boston Celtics, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 彭博社撤回有关南非债券的错误报道
item.description: 彭博社撤回了 3 月 19 日发表的一篇报道，该报道错误地引用了富兰克林资源公司、摩根大通和富国银行一直在出售其持有的南非债券的文件。该报道不符合彭博社的编辑标准。我们对这一错误表示遗憾。【原文：Bloomberg retracted a story published on March 19 that incorrectly cited filings as showing Franklin Resources, JPMorgan and Wells Fargo had been selling their South African bond holdings. The reporting did not meet Bloomberg’s editorial standards. We regret the error.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克就 X 的拆卸令起诉印度政府
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）正在就 X 的内容监管和审查问题起诉印度政府，这对于一位试图为特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Elon Musk is suing India’s government over content regulation and censorship of X, a surprise move for a billionaire trying to negotiate access for Tesla Inc. and Starlink.】

item.title: 特朗普力推燃煤发电与燃料的长期衰退相冲突
item.description:
他支持挖掘和钻探的行政命令可能不足以重振陷入困境的行业。【原文：

His executive orders supporting digging and drilling may not be enough to revive the beleaguered sector. 

】

item.title: Kraken 将以 15 亿美元收购期货平台 NinjaTrader
item.description: Kraken 将以 15 亿美元的价格收购零售期货交易平台 NinjaTrader，这将使该加密货币交易所首次在美国提供加密货币期货和衍生品，并将业务扩展到更多传统市场。【原文：Kraken is acquiring retail futures trading platform NinjaTrader for $1.5 billion, allowing the crypto exchange to offer crypto futures and derivatives in the US for the first time and to expand into more traditional markets.】

item.title: 欧盟推迟对美国威士忌征收 50%的关税，以便进行更多谈判
item.description: 欧盟将对美国威士忌征收 50%关税的提议推迟到 4 月中旬，使其与针对美国钢铝关税的更广泛反制措施保持一致。【原文：The European Union is delaying its proposed 50% tariff on American whiskey until mid-April, aligning them with broader countermeasures against US steel and aluminum duties.】

item.title: 罗尔斯-罗伊斯公司为月球核反应堆寻求太空合作伙伴
item.description: 罗尔斯-罗伊斯控股公司（Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc）正在为其微型核反应堆寻求与整个航天工业建立合作关系，该公司计划在 2030 年代初将该反应堆送上月球。【原文：Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc is seeking to establish partnerships across the space industry for its micro-nuclear reactor, which it plans to send to the moon in the early 2030s.】

item.title: 爱尔兰利用圣帕特里克节庆祝与美国的贸易往来
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统已明确表示，他希望改变 "不公平 "的贸易平衡，并挑出了与美国保持巨额逆差的国家。【原文：President Donald Trump has made it very clear he wants to change “unfair” trade balances, singling out countries with which the US maintains wide deficits.】

item.title: 鸽派转向谨慎，英格兰银行以 8 票对 1 票决定维持利率不变
item.description: 英国央行三位较为鸽派的成员决定不再立即降息，该小组在全球动荡的背景下保持政策稳定。【原文：Three of the Bank of England’s more dovish members decided against another immediate interest-rate cut, as the panel held policy steady in the face of a turbulent global backdrop.】

item.title: 欧洲央行对四月是否降息持 "开放态度
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员克拉斯-克诺（Klaas Knot）表示，欧洲央行需要评估德国的国防开支是否会刺激通胀。【原文：The European Central Bank will need to assess if Germany’s big defense splurge will stoke inflation, said Governing Council member Klaas Knot, who added that he hasn’t yet formed an opinion.】

item.title: 3 亿美元养牛欺诈索赔案震惊了热爱牛肉的国家
item.description: 一个以爱吃红肉而闻名的南美国家正面临着有史以来最大的一起散户投资者欺诈案，兜售牛投资的公司被指控从储蓄者手中骗取了数亿美元。【原文：A South American nation known for its love of red meat is facing one of its biggest-ever retail investor fraud cases, with companies peddling cattle investments accused of bilking savers out of hundreds of millions of dollars.】

item.title: 通用催化剂公司、萨姆-奥特曼支持营利性社区学院
item.description: CampusGroup Inc. 是一家提供两年制学位和认证的营利性社区学院，已从众多硅谷公司融资 4600 万美元，其中包括 Sam Altman、Peter Thiel 的创始人基金和 Figma Inc. 首席执行官 Dylan Field。【原文：CampusGroup Inc., a for-profit community college offering two-year degrees and certifications, has raised $46 million from a laundry list of Silicon Valley players — including Sam Altman, Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund and Figma Inc. chief Dylan Field.】

item.title: 4.5 万亿美元的 "三重魔咒 "再次考验投资者
item.description: 美国股市从上周低点反弹的势头将在周五面临新的考验，届时将有大量期权合约到期，这一季度性事件过去常常会刺激股市波动。【原文：US stocks’ rebound off of last week’s lows will face a new test on Friday, when a pile of options contracts are set to expire in a quarterly event that often stoked volatility in the past.】

item.title: 欧洲央行穆勒警告关税带来通胀上行风险
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒警告说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普推动征收贸易税可能会刺激通货膨胀。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Madis Muller warned that US President Donald Trump’s push to impose trade levies could stoke inflation.】

item.title: 施莱格尔称，SNB 不会追随特朗普的加密货币储备推动计划
item.description: 即使在唐纳德-特朗普总统推动建立美国战略储备之后，瑞士国家银行也不会购买比特币和类似的数字货币。【原文：The Swiss National Bank won’t buy Bitcoin and similar digital currencies, even after President Donald Trump made a push to establish a strategic US reserve.】

item.title: 埃利奥特就 LME 镍矿裁决向英国最高法院提出上诉被驳回
item.description: 埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）向英国最高法院起诉伦敦金属交易所 2022 年镍矿危机一案遭到拒绝。【原文：Elliott Investment Management was refused permission to take its case against the London Metal Exchange over the 2022 nickel crisis to the UK Supreme Court.】

item.title: 信用经济学家推崇吸引万亿资金进入股市的策略
item.description: 一小群先驱者希望，已发展成为数万亿美元股票市场的因子投资，能成为公司债券领域的下一个大事件；尤其是在唐纳德-特朗普的议程给整个资产市场带来冲击波的情况下。【原文：A small group of pioneers is hoping that factor investing, which has grown into a multi trillion-dollar market in equities, can become the next big thing in the world of corporate bonds — particularly with Donald Trump’s agenda sending shock waves across assets.】

item.title: Aviva 投资公司称德国国债收益率触及 4% 是可行的
item.description: Aviva Investors 认为，随着德国借贷成本的重置，德国 10 年期国债收益率升至 4% 是 "完全可行的"。【原文：Germany’s 10-year bond yield rising to 4% is “entirely feasible” as a reset in the country’s borrowing costs plays out, according to Aviva Investors.】

item.title: 波兰工资和产出削弱央行的稳健利率观点
item.description: 波兰的工资和工业产出数据正在挑战央行稳定的利率观点，并可能给决策者带来更大的压力，迫使他们自 2023 年以来首次削减借贷成本。【原文：Polish wage and industrial output data are challenging the central bank’s steady interest-rate view and are likely to pile more pressure on policymakers to cut borrowing costs for the first time since 2023.】

item.title: 人形生物（和爱他们的人类）的半程马拉松比赛
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，萨里塔-拉伊（Saritha Rai）将报道一项计划中的半程马拉松赛，届时双足机器人将与人类并肩作战。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Saritha Rai reports on a planned half-marathon where bipedal robots will run alongside humans.】

item.title: 美联储的 "过渡性好船 "在关税风中再次起航
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美联储的新经济展望。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. item.title: 一家人工智能初创公司无法击败微软。于是它加入了微软
item.description:
《AI Valley 》节选讲述了看似欣欣向荣的 Inflection AI 公司员工为何在 2024 年集体投奔微软的故事。【原文：

An excerpt from AI Valley tells the story of why the staff at Inflection AI, which seemed to be thriving, defected en masse to Microsoft in 2024.

】

item.title: 加拿大小型企业乐观情绪跌至 25 年最低点
item.description: 加拿大独立企业联合会（Canadian Federation of Independent Business）的数据显示，在美国对加拿大发动贸易战之后，加拿大中小型企业的乐观情绪降至至少四分之一世纪以来的最低水平。【原文：Optimism among Canada’s small and medium-sized firms fell to the lowest level in at least a quarter-century after the US started a trade war with the country, according to the Canadian Federation of Independent Business.】

item.title: 瑞士联合银行称瑞银全资化是最佳解决方案
item.description: 瑞士国家银行重申支持一项改革，该改革可能会迫使瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）保持多达 250 亿美元的额外资本。【原文：The Swiss National Bank reiterated its support for a reform that could see UBS Group AG forced to maintain as much as $25 billion in extra capital.】
